subsection_content:
Reducing your calorie intake and exercising regularly are your doctor's first recommendations. For patients with complications, it is necessary to use medication and apply more in-depth intervention methods.
Reduce eating: the main principle is that the amount of calories consumed needs to be less than the amount of calories used, so that the body uses energy from fat tissue, helping to achieve the goal of weight loss.; Increase exercise: Physical activity will help increase the use of stored energy, thereby helping to lose fat and maintain weight. Exercise will help control blood sugar levels in the body and reduce blood lipids.; Using medication: This is an option to support diet reduction and exercise. However, this method can leave many side effects, requires a long-term course of medication and is not effective for everyone.; Other measures: When obesity complications are too serious and hinder daily activities, the doctor may need to apply some special treatment measures such as surgery.
